title: What are the techniques and exercises used in non-verbal therapy and inductions?
first_phrase: This text is a continuation of the previous days' exercises and aims to introduce the use of sounds and metacommunicational codes in therapy and inductions. The text outlines several exercises that involve approaching the person using sounds and magnetism to bring them into a trance state, introducing nonverbal codes, and using magnetic passes and gestures to balance the HPA axis and brain hemispheres. The last part of the text also explains the importance of focalizing the client on their problem and finishing with a hypnodrama to bring the person to the center. Various techniques, such as fluidification and magnetic maps, are introduced to help facilitate the therapy process.

last_phrase: In conclusion, these techniques such as fluidification, magnetic passes, and moving therapy can have significant impacts on improving the parasympathetic and ortho-sympathetic systems, as well as activating the etheric body. By using these techniques correctly, one can also determine a client's magnetic type and musculature preferences, leading to better outcomes. These methods can be used for a variety of goals such as weight loss, relief from allergies, and smoking cessation. It's important to note that magnetism should be treated with respect and considered a sacred practice. With practice, one can improve their skills and better use these techniques for themselves and their clients.
